definition: to find time to do sth in the midst of pressing affairs
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
extraneous/redundant/superfluous/busy schedule
variant of 冗[rong3]

sentences.english: If you cannot attend, you may fill out the application form and send it back to us with a cheque.
sentences.chinese: 如未能拨冗出席，可填妥表格连同支票寄回。

sentences.english: That you didn't take that extra time for a smile, a hug, or a kiss.
sentences.chinese: 你没有拨冗送给他人的那个微笑，那个拥抱或那个吻。

sentences.english: So thanks to all of you for taking the time to be here this evening.
sentences.chinese: 感谢大家今晚拨冗莅临。

sentences.english: This match will only have 36 precious seats, we sincerely invite you to attend this tournament.
sentences.chinese: 首届比赛仅限36席珍贵席位，敬邀您拨冗参赛。

sentences.english: I want to thank you for taking time and for helping us out with this crowd-sourcing today.
sentences.chinese: 我要谢谢你们拨冗参与我们今天的节目。

definition: to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
(polite) do me the honor
we are honored by your presence
to call to pay one's respect/to call on
great kindness/magnificent hospitality
I beg to disturb you/I trespass on your hospitality/Thank you for your hospitality!
(of a notable person etc) to honor with one's presence and offer guidance (idiom)
excuse me
busy schedule
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to interview/to meet
to be indebted (to sb)
imperial chariot/(fig.) emperor/(polite) you
gratitude
